image.altText: Two women standing out the front of a women's shelter.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal-led domestic violence support service is demanding answers over stalled progress in establishing a women's shelter in remote Northern Territory.

title.children: Women's shelter demands answers from government, land council

image.altText: A jockey on a horse smiling, leaning forward to pat its head, with a crowd in the background.

props.synopsis: Two years after a near-fatal fall, 25-year-old Alice Springs-born jockey has had a bumper season with 32 wins. Now he is riding in the Melbourne Cup.

title.children: Alice Springs jockey to ride in Cup two years after near-fatal fall

image.altText: A woman wearing a visor and holding a tennis racket stands in a tennis court next to a loop fence.

props.synopsis: The impending departure of Rio Tinto raises concerns about the future of sporting clubs in Nhulunbuy. But there are hopes increased investment in regional sports can help sustain the community's active lifestyle.

title.children: Sporting clubs fear the worst as mining giant withdraws from Nhulunbuy

image.altText: A healthcare worker giving a Band-Aid to a young Indigenous child.

props.synopsis: Imagine visiting a health clinic where you may be exposed to asbestos, leaking roofs and lead in the water pipes. That's the reality for remote NT residents.

title.children: Asbestos, lead, a leaky roof: Healthcare in remote NT

image.altText: Stationary construction vehicles and various pieces of equipment dotted around a large patch of red dirt by the water's edge.

props.synopsis: The NT government will gain no direct revenue from the ship lift project, despite spending $820 million on its construction.

title.children: Darwin ship lift should proceed despite $720m cost increase, report finds

image.altText: A wide shot of a sign reading Tanumbirini Station with windmills in the distance.

props.synopsis: One of the Northern Territory's largest beef producers has failed in its bid to stop a gas company from trademarking the name of one of its cattle stations.

title.children: A cattle station and gas company have locked horns over the name 'Tanumbirini'

image.altText: Royal Darwin Hospital Intensive Care Unit

props.synopsis: The Acacia system was switched off at Royal Darwin Hospital's emergency department in January 2024 after it became a threat to patient safety.

title.children: Controversial patient record system to return to NT emergency department

image.altText: An Indigenous woman standing outside a construction site.

props.synopsis: Decades after Wadeye's last licensed social club was smashed to pieces amid a storm of controversy, locals will soon be able to have an after-work drink again.

title.children: Remote Aboriginal community returning to licensed liquor after 30 years

image.altText: New houses in a sub division in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: It's an inconvenient truth that a housing crisis that took a generation to create cannot be fixed easily. The damage will likely take another generation to undo, unless the solution comes at the expense of those who already own their homes.

title.children: House prices have been climbing for a generation. Will a fix take longer?

image.altText: A side-on court sketch of David Pye, showing him with a beard, bald head, ponytail and neck tattoos.

props.synopsis: With all the hallmarks of a Hollywood blockbuster, the high-profile murder trial of ex-bikie David Pye in WA's Supreme Court was never going to be a pedestrian affair.

title.children: How a Perth FIFO worker became a trained assassin who publicly executed a bikie

image.altText: Person waiting at lights on an fat tyre ebike

props.synopsis: Noticing a lot of e-bikes around lately? Here's a state-by-state breakdown of the laws about them.

title.children: What is the difference between an e-bike and an e-motorbike?

image.altText: Man with blonde hair wearing one earring.

props.synopsis: A man charged with the domestic violence murder of 39-year-old Hunter woman Rhukaya Lake is remanded in custody.

title.children: Man refused bail over accused murder of woman near Cessnock

image.altText: Kirsha Kaechele

props.synopsis: No men are allowed at Kirsha Kaechele's Ladies Lounge and the Supreme Court agrees. The artist, curator and "missus" of MONA's owner knows how to cross boundaries, but can she solve Tasmania's thorniest dispute?

title.children: Why the 'first lady' of MONA has always felt like an outsider

image.altText: Mojito mocktail

props.synopsis: Having a range of drinks on offer can help everyone feel included, especially at end-of-year gatherings.

title.children: Raise a glass to these easy low and no-alcohol drinks

image.altText: us president donald trump and canada prime minister mark carney.

props.synopsis: Canadian PM Mark Carney says he apologised to an "offended" US President Donald Trump over the ad, which led to trade talks being suspended and an additional 10 per cent tariff.

title.children: Canadian PM apologises to Trump over Reagan anti-tariff ad

image.altText: A man in a suit looking at the camera and giving the thumbs up sign with both hands. A small cart is visible in the background.

props.synopsis: Isaac Stein should be at his day job as a lawyer for the Internal Revenue Service, but instead, he's making hot dogs as the US government shutdown drags on.

title.children: In Washington DC, a hot dog stall symbolises the US government shutdown

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Let's get it straight: you'll probably do badly on this quiz, and I'll judge you. It's time to play … HARD!

title.children: Think you've got what it takes to top this quiz? Sure you do

image.altText: Jockey looks to the camera at the winning post, smiling after winning.

props.synopsis: Jockey Jamie Melham says she will be doing a "rain dance" on Monday, ahead of riding Melbourne Cup favourite Half Yours.

title.children: Melham confident Melbourne Cup favourite will handle rain and distance

image.altText: A koala holds onto a tree branch while looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A hidden group of koalas is found for the first time in a remote area of the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

title.children: 'Incredibly exciting': Thermal drones detect hidden koala cluster

image.altText: An edited image showing a horse removed from the picture during the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

title.children: How racing makes its deadliest moments disappear

image.altText: Blue and white police tape.

props.synopsis: Two people have been killed in fatal crashes across the Riverina just hours apart.

title.children: Police ask for help after body found in burnt-out ute

image.altText: The 100 metres pinnacle called the Pharos.

props.synopsis: Rock climbers are publicly urging others to ignore Parks Victoria's requests to avoid culturally significant routes at Mount Arapiles Dyurrite in western Victoria.

title.children: 'Keep climbing': Defiance grows over Mount Arapiles cultural requests

image.altText: Matthew Hauser competing at Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Only a fortnight after being crowned men's world champion, Australia's Matthew Hauser tops the podium at the revered Noosa Triathlon.

title.children: World champ Hauser claims first Noosa Triathlon title

image.altText: Amy Boyle-Carr, Ebony Marinoff and Grace Kelly of the Crows celebrate victory

props.synopsis: Adelaide has hung on for a thrilling 12-point win over Fremantle that secures its AFLW finals spot and ends the Dockers' season.

title.children: Crows hold on to earn home finals berth and end Dockers' AFLW season

image.altText: An older man stands between his daughter and granddaughter on an oval.

props.synopsis: Brian leads three generations of his family in the annual Variety Postie Bike Dash, raising money for sick and disadvantaged kids.

title.children: Three generations embark on six-day postie bike ride for charity

image.altText: A man with blonde hair in a suit shakes hand with a man with black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's gains are immediate and personal while Xi Jinping's are quiet, reversible, and strategic

title.children: Silence was strategy, not oversight in Trump's meeting with Xi

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a suit and red tie, speaks behind a sign that says United States.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is threatening to pull US aid and going "guns-a-blazing" as he accuses the Nigerian government of allowing the killing of Christians.

title.children: Trump warns Nigeria of military action over alleged killings of Christians

image.altText: an image grab of a new app for victim survivors of DV that reads hi this is dv notify

props.synopsis: DV Notify, a joint federal and NSW government led initiative, will provide real-time text and email updates from the time a violent offender is arrested through to their final sentencing.

title.children: Australian-first DV digital notification service to launch in NSW

image.altText: A still of Daniel Jarvis standing with the Kangaroos team during the national anthem before second Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: A man is arrested by police after he lined up next to Cameron Munster before the Kangaroos' victory over England in the second Ashes Test in England.

title.children: Pitch invader stands with Kangaroos during anthems before Ashes Test

image.altText: A graphic of playing cards falling through a basketball net

props.synopsis: The New York mafia is alive and an "historic" FBI bust has shown that underworld crime is still kicking across the United States.

title.children: New York's underbelly is thriving — this FBI case pulled back the curtain

image.altText: Dozens of tents pitched on the foreshore with the ocean waves in the background.

props.synopsis: Hamas says it offered to hand over samples of the unidentified bodies, but Israel refused and asked for the remains for examination.

title.children: Three bodies returned by Hamas are not those of hostages, Israel says

image.altText: man in maroon knit shows printed photos to his smiling elderly mother wearing a red headscarf and blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Discussing aged care in culturally diverse families can be a sensitive subject. Here's how some approached the conversation.

title.children: Diverse families struggle navigating the stigma around aged care

image.altText: The harvested logs being stacked ready for collection

props.synopsis: The Coalition says it cannot support major reforms to Australia's environment laws in their current reform, setting a bar as they enter deep negotiations with the federal government.

title.children: Coalition won't back environment reforms without changes

image.altText: Baseball team run to the centre of the field to celebrate victory

props.synopsis: The Los Angeles Dodgers rallied to beat the Toronto Blue Jays 5-4 in extra innings of a decisive seventh game of the World Series to become Major League Baseball's first repeat champion in 25 years.

title.children: Dodgers win back-to-back World Series with epic comeback in game seven

image.altText: Henry Pollock celebrates

props.synopsis: The Wallabies were overpowered by a disciplined and ruthless England team, who won their eighth-straight international to claim victory at Twickenham.

title.children: 'Woeful' Wallabies slammed by World Cup winner as England dominates
